alert.note: Alert for Anson; Richmond; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 9:06PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Richmond and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurinburg, Rockingham, Hamlet, Hoffman, Ellerbe, Dobbins Heights, Wagram, Gibson, East Laurinburg, Norman, Sandhills Game Land, East Rockingham, Laurel Hill, Camp Mackall, Derby, Diggs, Blewett Falls Lake and Covington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
